texts: Due to the improvement works at Wembley Park Underground Station, buses will replace trains on the Jubilee line between Neasden and Kingsbury during certain March and April weekends.

They include Saturdays and Sundays 5 & 6 March, 12 &13 March, 2 & 3 April, 9 & 10 April, 16 & 17 April and the whole of the Easter Bank Holiday weekend from Good Friday, 25 March to Easter Monday, 28 March.

Kevin Bootle, Jubilee line General Manager said: "Wembley Park Station is undergoing a major reconstruction. This will make it more pleasant to use and increase the station's capacity so that it will be ready for the opening of the new Wembley Stadium.
"I apologise for the inconvenience caused, but when this work is completed it will bring real benefits to passengers."
A Rail Replacement Bus service will operate between Neasden and Kingsbury calling at Wembley Park.
A 15 minute train service will operate between Stanmore and Kingsbury.

Passengers should allow an extra 40 minutes for their journeys, particularly if they are travelling late at night to central London from Wembley Park Station or north or west of it, in order to catch last train connections.
For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call020 7222 1234 or visit TfL's website .
Tube Lines are responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Jubilee, Northern and Piccadilly lines.
